title: Rugby World Cup 2019 squads: Every player from every team announced for Japan
text:
The 2019 Rugby World Cup is less than a month away, with teams beginning to name their final 31-man squads ahead of the 8 September deadline.

In what is the most nerve-wracking time for World Cup hopefuls, head coaches around the globe will have to make the difficult decisions of who does and doesn't go to Japan next month.

A number of teams have already announced their final squads for the World Cup, but there are still plenty left to go with the likes of New Zealand and Wales taking as much time as necessary to make the last-minute calls.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Here’s a list of all the final squads named for the 2019 Rugby World Cup so far.

Argentina

Props: Nahuel Tetaz Chaparro (54 caps), Juan Figallo (30), Santiago Medrano (14), Enqirue Pieretto (23), Mayco Vivas (4)

Hooker: Agustin Creevy (85), Julian Montoya (55), Santiago Socino (2)

Scrum-halves: Tomas Cubelli (72), Felipe Ezcurra (5)

Fly-halves: Nicolas Sanchez (77), Benjamin Urdapilleta (12)

Centres: Jeronimo de la Fuente (50), Juan Cruz Mallia (4), Lucas Mensa (1), Matias Moroni (43), Matias Orlando (41).
